resources.string: Macaroni noodles (macaroni)\n Grated Gouda cheese (geraspte Gouda kaas)\n Pepper (peper)

In a pot, boil water. Make sure there is enough to that the macaroni will sit completely submerged and still have room.\n Pour in the macaroni. Let it cook for 7-9 minutes.\n Drain the water from the pot. Serve the macaroni as is and top with Gouda cheese and some pepper.
French fries (frieten) \nBrown gravy (bruim jus) \nSmall Gouda cheese cubes (kleine Gouda kaas blokjes)

Cook the French fries as instructed on the bag. Cook the gravy as instructed on the bag. \nPut the French fries in a bowl and add gravy. Add the pieces of Gouda cheese on top. \nMicrowave until the cheese is slightly melted and enjoy.

500 g cooked rice (gekookte rijst） 
5 tbsp oil (olie) 
2 eggs (eieren) 
30g grated Gouda cheese (geraspte Gouda kaas) 
100 g minced pork (varkensgehakt ) 
Salt (zout) 
Sugar (suiker) 
Pepper (peper)

Heat half the oil in a large frying pan. the Add the minced pork and Gouda cheese stir-fry for 3 minutes. Add 1/2 teaspoon salt, and sugar and stir-fry for 1 minutes 
Add the rice to the wok to heat through, Turing and stirring well. 
Heat the remaining oil in another wok. Season the beaten egg with salt and pepper and add to the wok. Stir. 
Stir for about 1 minute, then turn the egg mixture into the wok containing the rice. Mix lightly together, then serve in a heated bowl.

500 g Flour (bloem) 
1 tbsp Oil (olie) 
250 ml Water (water) 
4 tsp Salt (zout) 
6 Eggs (eieren) 
3 Onions (uien) 
300 g Gouda, grated (geraspte Gouda kaas) 
Serves 4

Combine the eggs, the flour, the oil and all the salt (4 tsp) and mix all together for the dough 
Depending on the size of the eggs you should add some water to make the dough viscous 
In the meantime bring saltwater to the boil 
Put some dough on a breadboard and scrap it into the water in small noodle shapes 
After a short dwell they come back to the surface and can be picked out 
To make the “Spätzle“ unique “Käsespätzle“ you have to roast them in a pan together with the Gouda until the cheese is molten 
For serving put some roasted onion on top 
Alternative for low budget or lazy cooks: buy a package of “Spätzle“ and boil them

51 package crust 
0.5kg feta cheese 
0.5 kg gouda cheese 
80gr butter 
3 spoons corn flour 
750ml milk 
Freshly ground pepper 
80ml of olive oil for the brushing of the crust

In a large bowl, grate the gouda and the feta crumbles. In a mixing bowl add the eggs, flour, milk and pepper. Melt the butter gently without burning and add to the mixture of materials. Mix. 
You brush the pan with the olive oil and the crust. Then you put the crust (about half of them that are contained in the package) in the pan and you put oil in them. Pour the filling mixture, you have prepared, spread throughout the pan. 
Cover with the remaining crust sheets. 
Carefully chart the pie in squares without reaching the blade of the knife in the filling and bake at 180oC in air for 45 until the cheese to swell and the crust golden

2 eggs (2 eieren) 
4 slices of bread (4 sneetjes brood) 
Garlic Paste (knoflook pasta) 
Onions (uien) 
Gouda Cheese (Gouda kaas) 
Chillies (chilli) 
Salt (zout) 
Pepper (peper) 
Oil/Butter (olie/boter) 
Cornflower Powder (korenbloem poeder)

Mix all the ingredients (except bread and oil) together in a bowl. 
Layer bread quarters with the egg-cheese mixture and keep aside. 
Heat oil in a frying pan, carefully slide in the layered bread quarters (mixture side down) into the hot oil. Fry for 2-3 minutes, then turn over to other side. Fry until golden brown on either side. 
Drain excess oil on absorbent paper and serve piping hot, on a bed of cabbage leaves and accompanied by tomato ketchup.

Bananas (banaan) 
Butter (boter) 
Chocolate sprinklers (chocolade hagelslag) 
Gouda cheese (Gouda kaas) 
Condensed milk (gecondenseerde melk)

Heat the frying pan and put the butter, wait until it melts 
Slice the banana in half from up to bottom 
Pan roast the banana, wait until it become brownish in color 
Move the banana onto the plate 
Put the chocolate sprinklers on top of the banana 
Put the grated gouda cheese on top of the banana 
Pour the condensed milk on top of the banana

Bolognese sauce (Ragù) 600gr 
Lasagne pasta 500 gr 
Bèchamel 1 kg 
Gouda 200 gr 
Butter

Warm the Bolognese Sauce up 
Distribute ?? the butter on a baking pan 
Preheat the oven at 150 °C 
Distribute with a spoon the Bolognese sauce on the bottom of the pan 
Cover with a layer of Lasagne pasta 
With a spoon cover the lasagne with besciamella 
Add Bolognese sauce and cover with Gouda previously grinded 
Then add another layer of pasta and proceed in the same way until the pan is almost full 
At this point, in a pot mix the remaining Bèchamel and Ragù and cover the lasagne with abundant Gouda 
Place the pan in the oven for about 50-60 minutes until the surface is golden and crispy

Wait until a pot of salted water boils 
Grate Gouda cheese, 
Trow the spaghetti 
When cooking time is over, take the spaghetti out and take aside some cooking water 
Introduce all at once in the pan used to boil water: spaghetti, Gouda, hot water until creamy enough, then grind the black pepper and add couple of leaves
